lastSession.summary: Implemented complete StreamFilter request/response capture feature (feature-004) using multi-agent orchestration. Backend captures HTTP traffic via Firefox StreamFilter API with in-memory storage. Frontend provides Vue 3 UI with filtering, detail views, and auto-refresh. All type compatibility issues resolved, TypeScript compilation passing, Firefox build successful (107 kB).
completedTasks: Created feature-004: StreamFilter Request/Response Capture with UI
Orchestrated 3 specialized agents: research-analyst, typescript-pro, react-specialist
Backend: Created 4 lib files (request-capture, config, stream-filter, storage - 962 lines)
Backend: Updated wxt.config.ts with Firefox permissions (webRequest, webRequestBlocking)
Backend: Enhanced background.ts with StreamFilter integration (293 lines)
Frontend: Created 3 Vue components (RequestList, RequestDetail, RequestFilter - 713 lines)
Frontend: Rewrote App.vue popup UI (350 lines)
Frontend: Updated global styles for extension UI (82 lines)
Fixed type compatibility issues between backend and frontend
Added null safety for optional response handling in all UI components
Created computed properties for duration and size metadata
TypeScript compilation verified with no errors
Successfully built extension for Firefox (107 kB output)
nextSteps: Manual testing in Firefox: pnpm dev:firefox
Test request capture functionality with real websites
Verify UI filtering and detail views work correctly
Test auto-refresh and clear all features
Create PR for feature-004 when testing passes
Consider future enhancements: HAR export, request replay, better JSON formatting

recentChanges: lib/request-capture.ts - Complete data models and helpers (231 lines)
lib/config.ts - URL pattern configuration system (201 lines)
lib/stream-filter.ts - Firefox StreamFilter API wrapper (195 lines)
lib/storage.ts - In-memory storage with query capabilities (335 lines)
entrypoints/background.ts - StreamFilter integration with message handlers (293 lines)
components/RequestList.vue - Request table with color coding (252 lines)
